poem:
"Small Mercies on an Easter Morn"

Her memory threads to a childhood dress,
Empire waist, cap sleeves' embrace.
Easter, blooming like a tender confession,
Bearing love's anniversary and last year's refrain.
Boyfriend and Baptist, she texts in jest,
Through chuckled echoes of an orthodox past.
Lord knows, we all seek forgiveness,
In baptismal baths and humour-forged texts.

It made her disdain her breasts because". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
